questions.text: Buddy's first son with Ellen was named Cliff.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Cliff was ten years old at the time Grant Morrison began revamping Animal Man in 1988. His sister is Maxine, who was six years old at the time Morrison began his run.

questions.text: Animal Man made his debut in this comic.
questions.explanation:
Strange Adventures.

	"Buddy" Baker first appeared in issue #180 of "Strange Adventures". This issue was released in September of 1965, and Animal Man was created by Carmine Infantino and Dave Wood.

questions.text: Animal Man has been a member of the Justice League Europe.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Animal Man has also been an ally of the Justice League of America, brought in when his expertise is needed. This can be seen in "Identity Crisis", when Animal Man is in Sue Dibny's apartment searching for an animal scent.

questions.text: Buddy formed a friendship with this superhero while adventuring in space towards New Cronos.
questions.explanation:
Firestorm.

	Jason Rusch was the Firestorm at that time, the older superhero mentoring the younger in the use of his powers. Other heroes who accompanied Animal Man included Donna Troy.

questions.text: Along with Cave Carson and Dolphin, Animal Man is a member of what team?
questions.explanation:
The Forgotten Heroes.

	The Forgotten Heroes were a group of "forgotten" and second-string heroes who banded together to fight crime. It was with this group that Animal Man was seen in "Crisis on Infinite Earths".

questions.text: In the pages of his own comic book, Animal Man met this comic book writer/artist.
questions.explanation:
Grant Morrison.

	Grant Morrison's run on "Animal Man" was notable for breaking the fourth wall and for testing the restraints between the comic world and the real world. Ultimately, Animal Man is told that he is not real.

questions.text: When he was first introduced, who did Animal Man say gave him his powers?
questions.explanation:
An extraterrestrial spaceship.

	Animal Man gained his powers when he was in close proximity to an exploding alien spaceship. As a result, he can borrow a trait from any animal provided that they are close enough.

questions.text: In the pages of "52", Animal Man was stranded on an alien planet with Adam Strange and Starfire. Which supervillain fought them?
questions.explanation:
Devilance the Pursuer.

	Devilance is one of Darkseid's underlings, but had not been seen for quite some time before his appearance in "52". He carries an energy lance to pursue and capture his enemies.

questions.text: When Buddy is home looking for his space suit, Maxine gives him a peanut-butter and banana sandwich.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Animal Man has a space suit given to him by Adam Strange, but his wife Ellen threw it out because it was lacking rocket fuel.

True.

	Morrison fleshed Animal Man out as an animal rights activist and a vegetarian. Later on, he stopped wearing leather for the same reasons.
